intro: Trollius europaeus subf. micranthus, commonly known as the lesser globeflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features showy, golden-yellow, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a short, thick rhizome and basal leaves that are broadly ovate with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically 2–4 cm in diameter and are composed of many small, petal-like rays. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
